sub_title: Expert on sustainable value chains and landscapes including agricultural and forest land use
summary:
I have founded Jinke van Dam Consultancy in 2010. I am a highly experienced and motivated consultant with more than 20+ years of international experience in sustainable value chains and land use for all kinds of biomass end-uses (fuel, heat, power, materials, food and feed). 

The global sustainability challenges of today (climate change, degradation, food security) are complex and ask for integrated solutions.  There is no single solution and action is needed from all sectors involved (e.g. agriculture, forestry, finance or governance). 

My educational background and working experience in both the agricultural and forestry sector, and in the biobased economy, make me highly effective to understand and connect these worlds and to develop sustainable strategies and innovative solutions.

I have strong analytical skills and profound knowledge in sustainable land uses and their governance, landscape approaches, impact assessments, certification systems and commodities.

profile_positions.description:
Working on different projects in the field of sustainable land use, responsible and deforestation-free sourcing, value chains, assurance, certification, impact assessments and tool development.

Some of my projects (see also website):
* Mainstreaming forests where they matter most. Key pointers for Dutch international policy for forests
* An analysis of existing laws on forest protection in the main soy producing countries in Latin America
* Policy brief 'Key pointers for an ambitious EU deforestation-free action plan' as input for the EU Action Plan against deforestation, Tropenbos International
* The charcoal transition: Greening the charcoal value chain to mitigate climate change and improve local livelihoods (FAO)
* Evaluation of contribution of forest related projects to SDGs
* Analysis for developing a support program to stimulate certification under small forest owners
* External evaluator of assurance program certification system
* Interim Consultant as Senior Biobased Economy - IUCN
* Landscape approaches and avoiding deforestation in the Gran Chaco 
* Benchmark studies for comparing certification systems and sustainability policies
* Analysis and compiling lessons learnt from funded biomass projects in Netherlands
* Learning, assurance and credibility of certification standards: innovative approaches
* Co-author IUCN publication “Betting for best quality”
* Risk assessment of cross-recognition and changes in content of certification systems for biofuels
* Exploring financing mechanisms to enhance biodiversity in soy producing areas
* Sustainability effect risk analysis and lessons learned from co-regulation
* Evaluating of certification systems on their level of assurance, costs and benefits
* Advice on sustainability policies to large international biofuels trade
* Assistance for bioenergy projects in developing countries on impact assessment
* International and national initiatives to enhance legal production and trading of forest wood
profile_positions.title: Expert on sustainable value chains and landscapes including agricultural and forest land use

profile_positions.description:
SQ Consult is an international consultancy, working with a network of senior, independent consultants in the topic of climate change and renewable energy. 
See: www.sqconsult.com
profile_positions.title: Associate

profile_positions.description:
* Finalized article on ongoing initiatives in the field of certification for biomass and bioenergy incl comparison of criteria and implementation procedures. 
* Background document available with overview of relevant certification systems and initiatives for biomass and bioenergy, implemented within the framework of Bioenergy Task 40.
* Results questionnaire (288 results from 25 different EU countries) on stakeholder perceptions on harmonization bioenergy certification, as part of EUBIONET III project: www.eubionet.net
* Working on impact assessment regional case studies (Africa, South America, Brazil, China, India, US), SASOL project and involved in IEA Bioenergy Task 40.
* Participating in Global BIOPACT: analyzing socio-economic impacts of biomass and bioenergy production in different world regions
* ALso supervising PhD students and regular speaker at conferences
profile_positions.title: Sr Researcher sustainable biomass and bioenergy

profile_positions.description: Finalized PhD thesis in 'Sustainability of bioenergy chains: the result is in the details on May 13, 2009. The thesis concludes that it is possible to estimate ex ante the potential, economics and sustainability performance of bioenergy chains on a regional level. Studies included are a.o. case studies in Argentina and in Central and Eastern Europe, an overview of the status of initiatives in the field of biomass certification and a proposal for a unified methodology to calculate the GHG balance.
profile_positions.title: Researcher biomass and bioenergy

profile_positions.description: Research consultant based in Argentina to look at the feasibility of sustainable biomass production in Argentina for two selected crops (soybean and switchgrass). Financed by Solidaridad (NGO) and  supervised by Utrecht University
profile_positions.title: Research consultant Argentina

profile_positions.description: Roundtable on Responsible Soy Association is an international initiative from NGOs, companies and producers active in the soy value chain to promote the responsible production, processing and trade of soy. See also www.responsiblesoy.org. The Secretariat is currently based in Buenos Aires, Argentina
profile_positions.title: Interim Executive Secretariat Roundtable on Responsible Soy Association
